greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k > 1 such that n*(n+1)*...*(n+k-1) / (n+(n+1)+...+(n+k-1)) is an integer.
comment: a(n) = 9 for n == 53 (mod 105). - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Mar 14 2014
example: 1*2/(1+2) = 2/3 is not an integer. 1*2*3/(1+2+3) = 1 is an integer. Thus a(1) = 3.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {k = 2; while ( prod(i=0, k-1, n+i) % sum(i=0, k-1, n+i), k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 14 2014
results.author: _Derek Orr_, Mar 13 2014
